Stablecoin Panel

Sam Trautwein Founder & CEO, Carbon-12 Labs, MakerDAO

Sam Trautwein is the CEO & Co-Founder of Carbon, a FinTech company that aims to make the global economy both more inclusive and efficient through the use of distributed ledger technology and artificial intelligence. Carbon’s investors include General Catalyst, Firstmark, Plug and Play, Digital Currency Group, and The Fund. Sam grew up in the Dominican Republic and attended Stanford University, where he studied Computer Science with a concentration in AI. He has focused mainly on distributed systems, market design, and encryption. Prior to Carbon, he was a founding member of the Computer Science team at Plenty, an AI hydroponics company backed by Softbank.

Stablecoin Panel

Omid Malekan Blockchain Innovation Expert, Citi Ventures

Omid Malekan is the Explainer-in-Chief of blockchain technology. He's the author of "The Story of the Blockchain, A Beginner's Guide to the Technology That Nobody Understands" (CreateSpace) as well as a myriad of essays on the many applications of the technology. He works as a blockchain innovation expert at Citi Ventures and conducts executive training through Conversance"

International Development and Humanitarian Work Blockchain Use Cases

Blockchain use cases in international development and humanitarian work.

Ariana Fowler Ariana Fowler is passionate about the role of emerging technology in emerging markets as a long-term solution to international development issues. Her academic research specialized in refugee-related interventions, as well as the economic implications of the refugee crisis. She has conducted field work in Ghana & Honduras and was awarded the Critical Language Scholarship to study Urdu in northern India. Most recently at ConsenSys, she sat on the Social Impact team, consulting on client-facing projects in the public, private and not-for-profit sectors, as well as developing use-cases and research studies focusing on the application of blockchain technology as it relates to development and humanitarian aid., Frontiers

International Development and Humanitarian Work Blockchain Use Cases

Blockchain use cases in international development and humanitarian work.

Joyce Yang Founder, Global Coin Research

Joyce Yang is the founder of Global Coin Research, a subscription-based newsletter that provides insights and analysis on the Cryptocurrency and Blockchain happenings in Asia. In the crypto landscape, Asia is headquarters to the top exchanges that make up over 50% of cryptocurrency trading volume, and houses the largest mining companies with over 60% of hash power. No matter how you look at it, not knowing what's going on in Asia means that you only see half of the picture. Joyce formerly worked as a research analyst at Merrill Lynch and CICC (the largest Chinese investment bank) writing about Technology companies. She received her BA from Harvard University.

Simulating Cryptoeconomic Stability

Gauntlet Networks and the role of simulation in optimizing cryptoeconomic stability.

Tarun Chitra Founder & CEO, Gauntlet Networks

Tarun Chitra is an alumni of D. E. Shaw Research (DESRES), Vatic Labs, a high-frequency trading firm, and Cornell. He fell into the blockchain world in 2011, when he was working on ASICs at DESRES and observed Bitcoin ASIC mining rigs substantially delay DESRES’s ASIC production. He has spent the last seven years working on simulation-based R&D at the intersection of high-performance computing and AI and is applying this knowledge to the blockchain ecosystem.

Trustworthy Smart Contracts

Kadena is a next generation blockchain ecosystem that is bringing trustworthy smart contracts to everyone.

Monica Quaintance Head of Research and Networks, Kadena

Monica Quaintance is head of Research and Networks at Kadena. She is a former tech lead and Senior Data Engineer at Rent the Runway and a former Qualitative Analytics Engineer at the SEC. Prior to that, as an Investment Banking Associate Monica securitized and restructured commercial real estate assets at Cushman and Wakefield. Monica has degrees in Statistics and Probability as well as Economics from Columbia University. Monica is also a co-founder of Universal Consensus, a blockchain-focused pro-diversity organization.

Hedera Hashgraph Protocol

Overview of Hedera Hashgraph's protocol.

Tom Trowbridge President, Hedera

Tom was part of the founding team of Hedera with broad responsibility across the business, and is the President of Hedera. He has been advising and investing in technology companies since 1996 when started his career as an investment banker in the telecom group of Bear, Stearns & Co. He began investing in early stage companies in 1998 when he joined the private equity firm Alta Communications and over three and a half years executed ten deals in technology, telecom, and media and served on multiple boards. After Alta Communications, he spent almost four years at Goldman Sachs before holding various positions at Lombard Odier and Atticus Capital. Before joining Hedera, he started and ran the New York office for UK-based Odey Asset Management. Tom has a BA from Yale University and an MBA from Columbia University with honors (Beta Gamma Sigma).

Permissioned Ledgers Panel

Permissioned Ledgers (moderated by Jared Madfes, Advisor to Omega One and Founder of Blockswan)

Petr Novotny Research Staff, IBM T.J. Watson Research Center

Petr Novotny is a Research Staff Member at IBM T.J. Watson Research Center in NY, where he works on innovations of Blockchain technologies, contributes to the Hyperledger Fabric project, leads the development of Blockchain based analytical, audit and compliance methods and tools, and leads the development of seminal Blockchain based industry use cases in areas including finance, trading, media, and others. He has more than 15 years of experience in engineering and research of distributed software systems. He received the M.Sc. degree from University College London and the Ph.D. degree from Imperial College London, where he was also a post-doctoral Research Associate, as well as visiting scientist at the U.S. Army Research Laboratory. He is a co-author of a series of publications on blockchain topics, a co-inventor of a number of patent applications on blockchain technologies, as well as a co-author of the book: Hands-On Blockchain with Hyperledger: Building decentralized applications with Hyperledger Fabric and Composer.

Legal Regulation in Crypto

Regulatory developments in the crypto space; current regulatory landscape for token offerings.

Chi-Ru Jou Partner, CKR Law LLP

Chi-Ru Jou is a Partner in the Blockchain Technology & Digital Currency Group of CKR Law LLP, a global law firm with approximately fifty offices worldwide and more than forty attorneys contributing to the blockchain group. Ms. Jou began her career practicing securities litigation at the prominent international law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP and was most recently a Partner in the Blockchain & Digital Currency Group at Emergent LLP. She received her J.D. from Columbia Law School as a James Kent Scholar and her A.B. magna cum laude, Phi Beta Kappa from Harvard University.

ConsenSys operations

Ade Ajanaku Fund Foundry & ConsenSys Capital Asset Management, ConsenSys

ConsenSys operations

ConsenSys operations

Faisal Kahn Strategy & Business Development, ConsenSys

Faisal leads strategy and business development for PegaSys, the Enterprise Ethereum arm of ConsenSys. Prior to his work in blockchain, Faisal worked in management consulting on projects in technology, financial services, and government. He has a BA in Economics and Arabic from Williams College and an MBA from Columbia Business School.

cmorq Data Structure for Blockchain Data

Overview of cmorq, a platform which organizes blockchain data.

Hossein Azari Co-Founder & CEO, cmorq

No bio available

Blockchain and Investment Banking Panel

Blockchain and Investment Banking. (moderated by Alex Price, Founding Partner at Qu Capital)

Matthew Austin Blockchain Strategy, JP Morgan

Matt Austin works within the Blockchain Center of Excellence for the Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) at J.P. Morgan. He is tasked with developing a comprehensive blockchain strategy across business lines, implementing cutting edge technology solutions, conducting in-depth industry research and analysis, and performing client outreach. Previously, Matt was the business manager for the CIB’s Channels, Analytics and Innovation organization. In that role, Matt advanced a comprehensive innovation strategy across Treasury Services and led the global team’s operations and finance functions. Prior to joining J.P. Morgan, he worked in venture capital at Khosla Ventures in San Francisco where he managed a pipeline of over 150 active early and late stage portfolio companies representing over $4.5B in total value. Prior to that role, Matt worked at Conversion Capital, a FinTech focused venture capital firm based in New York. Matt started his career in KPMG’s Banking & Capital Markets practice before attending Columbia Business School, where he received his MBA focused on entrepreneurial finance. Matt is also a licensed CPA in New York State and an alumnus of Le Moyne College in Syracuse.

Axoni Programming Language for Secure Smart Contracts

Enterprise production implementations of blockchain, and/or AxLang, a new programming language Axoni is developing and will soon release open source to enable safer, more secure smart contracts on Ethereum.

Emily Yu Lead Technical Product Manager, Axioni

Emily Yu is the lead Technical Product Manager at Axoni. She designs features for Axoni’s platform products, in addition to leading production-grade client engagements with major financial institutions. Outside of work, she is an avid snowboarder, traveler and doesn’t get social media.

Axoni Programming Language for Secure Smart Contracts

Enterprise production implementations of blockchain, and/or AxLang, a new programming language Axoni is developing and will soon release open source to enable safer, more secure smart contracts on Ethereum.

Josh Dillon Technical Product Manager, Axoni

Josh Dillon is a Technical Product Manager at Axoni and focuses on designing infrastructure products for deploying blockchains. Josh graduated Columbia University in 2016, where he studied Computer Science-Statistics. He is a self-certified Master Hiker, drinks Red Bull for the taste and once melted a mattress with an Arduino.

ZCash Overview

Technical overview of ZCash.

Eran Tromer Founding Scientist, ZCash

Associate professor of Computer Science, Tel Aviv University; research scientist, Columbia University; founding scientist, Zcash

Beyond Blockchain: Developing Technology for Decentralization

Technologies, aside from blockchains, necessary for decentralization, applicability of blockchains in the finance industry and the user experience challenges with building blockchain applications.

Vishakh Null Co-Founder, Cryptonomic

No bio available

Permissioned Ledgers Panel

Permissioned Ledgers (moderated by Jared Madfes, Advisor to Omega One and Founder of Blockswan)

George Calle Research Member, R3

George Calle is a member of the research team at R3, an enterprise software company that supports the blockchain platform, Corda. At R3, George focuses on blockchain applications and features deployed within enterprises. George graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, where he studied Politics, Philosophy and Economics.
